dialogues.text: You've become a dealer, Chon?

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: No! How could you think that! I am still a Counselor for Social Affairs in the City Hall! The suitcase appeared in my closet. Imagine the scandal if the police find out. They could put me in jail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly!

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: I have to get rid of those fifteen kilos as soon as possible. (Thinks.) Because of the hours we keep, politicians consume a lot of drugs. So, between my party cohorts and city hall, I could distribute two kilos, but what do I do with the rest!

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: Throw it out!

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? How could I throw it out?! I have to keep the police from finding it in my house... I have to take it some other place, immediately!

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: But I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: (Interrupts.) Well, it's clear, honey!

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: (Finishes her question.) How is it that the suitcase appeared in your closet?

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: (Drinks a little coffee, and takes a bite from a pastry.) As I was telling you, after breaking up with my husband, I bumped into this guy on the street who kept watching at me, good-looking, well hung. Summing up, I took him home and screwed him over and over... (Takes another sip of coffee.)

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: An how was he?

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: In bed? Divine. Look at my arm hair? I've got goose-bumps! (She shows her the hair on her arm, 213

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing straight up.) He's that kind of guy who knows how to drive a woman mad with pleasure!

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: So you lost your mind...

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: What else could I do?! So he asked me if he could stay at my place for a few days and I said OK, but I couldn't promise anything. I didn't want him thinking that I was that easy. So (breathes in) he brought the suitcase. He asked me if I cared if he kept it in the closet. He said that he was attached to the suitcase. And, well, why would I care?! (breathes in) By pure chance, I am watching TV last night and I find out that the police have nabbed him in the course of a drug sting operation and that he is one of the most wanted traffickers! I open the suitcase and I discover that it is filled with little bags of cocaine. I ran out of the house and I haven't returned since...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pina breathes out in solidarity.

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: What a story, my God!

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: (Concluding.) I was wondering why he was such a good fuck! For men living in such high-stakes conditions, each fuck could be the last! (She reaches her arm out, again.) Look, the goose-bumps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, she shows Pina her arm, hair standing straigh

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: I've seen them already... They comes easy for you... (Changing topic.) And the suitcase?

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: (Humble.) I was going to ask you... if you didn't mind that I brought it here. If they find it in my house, well, it's not about what could happen to me, but that it's just not an ideal situation for the Counselor of Social Affairs. Imagine how upset the mayor would be, and my party! My party can't take one more scandal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings:

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: The police!

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: Shush, how could it be the police?! No one knows you're here!

dialogues.speaker: CHON
dialogues.text: I am a woman who attracts attention, Pina. Since I was a little girl...

dialogues.speaker: PINA
dialogues.text: Just pretend you're here for coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pina limps toward the door, uncertain. (Behind it she wil adventures). She looks back, toward Chon, half-smiling, t charming, filled with understanding and a love for life, emotions and its contradictions. It's with this half-smil Magdalena's face that the sequence arrives at its end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mateo, Judit, Diego, and the new editor, somewhat removed are seated in front of the editing table, they are both m entertained.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: This is hilarious!

dialogues.speaker: MATEO
dialogues.text: (Wants to be sure.) It doesn't sound like what we watched on TV, right?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Not at all! This is a whole different thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judit is the one who is most deeply moved. She may cry, b her tears will be happy tears, welcome tears.

dialogues.speaker: JUDIT
dialogues.text: It's wonderful, Mateo. We should re-release it.

dialogues.speaker: MATEO
dialogues.text: The important thing is to finish it. Films must be finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judit keeps crying.
